revision.comment: removed [[Category:1530s in Italy]]; added [[Category:1537 in Italy]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox military conflict |conflict = Battle of [[Montemurlo]] |partof = [[Italian War of 1536–1538]] |image = [[File:Battista franco, la battaglia di montemurlo e il ratto di Ganimede.jpg|300px]] |caption = ''The Battle of Montemurlo and the Rape of Ganymede'', by [[Battista Franco Veneziano]]{{cite book|last=Cox-Rearick|first=Janet|title=Bronzino's Chapel of Eleonora in the Palazzo Vecchio|year=1993|publisher=Univ. of California Press|location=Berkeley|isbn=978-0-520-07480-4|pages=303–04|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=u0qDanMDrtQC&lpg=PA315&dq=battle%20of%20Montemurlo&pg=PA304#v=onepage&q=battle%20of%20Montemurlo&f=false}} |date = 2 August 1537 |place = [[Montemurlo]], [[Province of Prato|Prato]], [[Tuscany]], [[Italy]] |no-location-property=yes |result = Victory for the [[Medici]] family and its supporters{{cite book|last=Littel|first=Eliakim|title=The Living Age, Vol. 144|year=1880|publisher=Littel & Co|location=Boston, Massachusetts|pages=588|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YQ93DRvM434C&dq=battle%20of%20Montemurlo&pg=PA588#v=onepage&q=battle%20of%20Montemurlo&f=false}} |combatant1 = [[File:Medici Flag of Tuscany.png|200px]]
[[Duchy of Florence]] ([[Cosimo I de' Medici, Grand Duke of Tuscany|Duke Cosimo I]]) |combatant2 = [[File:Flag of Florence.svg|200px]]
[[Republic of Florence|Supporters of the Republic of Florence]] |commander1 = [[File:Coa fam ITA vitelli.jpg|25px]] [[Alessandro Vitelli]] |commander2 = [[File:Blason it famille Strozzi.svg|25px]][[Piero Strozzi]]
[[File:Stamma salviati vetrata2.jpg|25px]] [[Bernardo Salviati]] |strength1 = 700 infantry
100 Cavalry {{cite encyclopedia|encyclopedia=The Encyclopaedia Britannica| volume=18|year=1911|publisher=Encyclopaedia Britannica|location=New York|pages=36|author=Pasquale Villari|title=The Medici|edition=11th|editor=Hugh Chisolm|quote=On the evening of the 31st of July Vitelli marched towards Prato with seven hundred picked infantry and a band of one hundred horse and on the way fell in with other Spanish foot soldiers who joined the expedition.}} |strength2 = |casualties1 = |casualties2 = }} On 1{{cite book|last=Young|first=Colonel G. F.|title=The Medici|year=1930|publisher=Kessinger Publications|location=[Whitefish, MT]|isbn=978-1-4191-8129-0|pages=553|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QA0haOEBCToC&lpg=PA553&dq=Battle%20of%20Montemurlo%202%20August%201537&pg=PA553#v=onepage&q=Battle%20of%20Montemurlo%202%20August%201537&f=false|accessdate=7 December 2011|quote=1st August 1537}} or 2{{cite book|last=Bull|first=translated by George|title=The lives of the artists; a selection|year=1965|publisher=Penguin Books|location=Baltimore|isbn=978-0-14-044460-5|pages=266|edition=Repr.|quote=2 August 1537}} August 1537 (both dates are given in sources), near the [[Tuscany|Tuscan]] village of [[Montemurlo]], the forces of the newly installed Duke [[Cosimo I de' Medici, Grand Duke of Tuscany|Cosimo I of Florence]] defeated a hastily organized army of those who wished to overthrow the [[Medici]] and restore the [[Republic of Florence]].{{cite book|last=Davies|first=Jonathan|title=Culture and power : Tuscany and its universities 1537-1609|year=2009|publisher=Brill|location=Leiden|isbn=978-90-04-17255-5|pages=31|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=AK74D-qTC4kC&lpg=PA31&dq=battle%20of%20Montemurlo&pg=PA31#v=onepage&q=battle%20of%20Montemurlo&f=false|edition=[Online-Ausg.].}} Following the battle, Cosimo's bloody vengeance on all those who opposed Medici rule effectively ended organized opposition to his family in Florence. The victory led to the decision of Emperor [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles V]] to formally recognize Cosimo as [[Duke of Florence]] on 30 September 1537.{{cite book|last=Spini|first=Georgio|title=Cosimo I e l'indipendenza del Principato Mediceo|year=1980|publisher=Vallecchi Ed|location=Florence, Italy|pages=84–91|language=Italian}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{coord missing|Italy}} [[Category:Battles involving Florence|Montemurlo]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1537|Montemurlo]] [[Category:1537 in Italy]] [[Category:1537 in Europe]] {{Battle-stub}}
